result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron J Woldt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cameron J Woldt appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty appeared by video for Cameron J Woldt.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requested an adjournment. State did not object. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Cameron J Woldt in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cameron J Woldt appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court is in receipt of defense's motoin to adjourn.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case rescheduled for 8/18/2022 at 9:00 am for status conference by zoom.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defense's Letter to Adjourn Status Conference

Defendant Cameron J Woldt in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery bu tno  offer. State will email  defense counsel an Offer. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cameron J Woldt in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed by Attorney Thomas Simon.
